-1001309472884,"Inmobi Hiring Fresher For Intern -Tech Branding, Content Strategy & Operations

Many of you ask us about other programs where you can spread the word about GSoC and Open source to your universities. We wanted to pass along an opportunity to help spread more open source knowledge in your universities and learn about many Google technologies to help you and your colleagues in your careers.

If you are still a university student with another 1.5-2 years of university left, you might be interested in being a lead for Developer Student Clubs, a Google Developers community program that launched in 2017 and is currently available to students in most countries (currently not available in China or Japan).

Developer Student Clubs are university based community groups for students interested in Google developer technologies. Students from all undergraduate or graduate programs with an interest in growing as a developer are welcome. By joining a DSC, students grow their knowledge in a peer-to-peer learning environment and build solutions for local businesses and their community.
Do you want to open a Developer Student Club chapter at your university? Join the community of 860 chapters around the world.
Impact other students by training them
Build solutions for local problems in the community
Be a part of a global network
Gain access to Google technology and platforms
Get invitations to select Google events and conferences
Attend a DSC Leads Summit and meet other leads and Googlers
Fill out the interest form here. Interest forms close May 15, 2020 at 11:59pm, PST.
Feel free to share this email with other student developers or share the announcement from the official @GoogleDevelopers: Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and/or Blog.

To learn more visit
developers.google.com/community/dsc"
